title: Make porcuquine a global code owner.
body: Make me a global code owner so my PR approvals suffice to merge.

title: fix: improve paramcache

When no sizes are given as input, you get a multiselect dialog on
the terminal.

Also the parameter generation now has a spinning indicator while
parameters are generated.

body: Resolves #1107

title: GPU-CPU-test using Winning PoSt
body:
This PR enables the gpu-cpu-testing tool again. I've verified manually that it does what it should do and that things actually work (with threads as well as with separate processes).

I've split it into two commits for easier review. You would want to have a look at https://github.com/filecoin-project/rust-fil-proofs/commit/54b2b2ee6ca6d3d676c066e7f04e8b1f98cebc06 only, which shows what actually changed compared to the old version (the other stuff was already reviewed in the past).

I've also added a README in hope that this tool can also be run by someone who is not me in the future and still be useful.

title: style: add myself as codeowner
tooling: refactor create_replicas()
body:
In the fil-proofs-tooling it's a common operation to create replicas. This creation is now properly refactored so that it can be used by several binaries.

This commit doesn't change any functionality it's a pure refactoring.

The commits are self-contained so this PR might be easier to review on a commit per commit basis.

body:
This PR fixes parts of https://github.com/filecoin-project/rust-fil-proofs/issues/1079.

I originally misunderstood some of the requirements, hence it got fancier then probably anticipated. You can now select the sizes you want to publish, with having the defaults pre-selected.

This PR can also be reviewed commit per commit, I tried to make them self-contained (the commit message should explain some of the reasons for some of the changes).

@DrPeterVanNostrand I've added you for review as I updated dialoguer, which also needed a little change in the phase2 bin code. I just want to make sure you are aware of that change, in case something breaks (which I won't expect).

This PR supersedes #1090.

title: ci: fix file descriptor limits on macOS
body:
fixes errors in CircleCI mac builds, such as
```
---- fallback::vanilla::tests::fallback_post_poseidon_two_partitions_smaller_top_8_8_2 stdout ----
thread 'fallback::vanilla::tests::fallback_post_poseidon_two_partitions_smaller_top_8_8_2' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Too many open files (os error 24)', /Users/distiller/crate/storage-proofs/core/src/merkle/builders.rs:411:13
```

Fix sets ulimit for system, users (`sudo ulimit` calls) and then user sets ulimit (without `sudo`)

body:
This helps compile times and makes dev cycles quicker.

There are now
- storage-proofs-core - everything shared
- storage-proofs-porep - all poreps
- storage-proofs-post - all posts
- storage-proofs - same api as before, reexports the others

title: fix: check updated store path on verify after precommit phase1
fix: DRG parent generation
body:
This PR makes the following changes to DRG parent generation:

- fixes an off by one error in the number of buckets
- removes unnecessary and dead code related to parent number addition
- fixes bugs introduced by improper casting
- makes explicit the type differences between DRG node indexes `u32` and metagraph node indexes `u64`, neither should be `usize`
- replaces `rng.gen_range()`
- changes the rng from `ChaCha20` to `ChaCha8`
- clarifies variable names

Closes #1065, #1067

refactor(filecoin-proofs): pad_reader::PadReader fr32_reader::Fr32Reader
body:
For clarity, since padding input data to achieve correct ^2 output size prior to CommP calculation is also required.

Ref #1061 

tbh I've been messing with and around Fr32 padding for a couple of months now but I still don't know what it stands for, is it an acronym? Therefore, I don't know for sure that using the name "Fr32Reader" makes as much sense as it could.

Is this "feat", "fix", "chore", or something else? It's a breaking change but it was only exposed publicly a couple of days ago so maybe a "fix"?

title: feat(filecoin-proofs): add phase2 cli
feat(filecoin-proofs): expose filecoin_proofs::pad_reader
body:
Make pub so we can use it outside.

Additional request: can we change the name of this to `fr32_pad_reader::Fr32PadReader`? We've got naming confusion with the base2 size padding that's done prior to hand-off to `generate_piece_commitment()`, which now even has its own repo: https://github.com/filecoin-project/go-padreader (also of note is that this new repo's README talks as if it's bit padding and not zero-byte extended padding so confusion already abounds). It comes out of Lotus https://github.com/filecoin-project/lotus/blob/a1f676bf3047646750aa394281a328decd0dd7c4/lib/padreader/padreader.go, made its way to go-fil-markets and is now in its own repo. I'm also having to rename my Rust "PadReader" @ https://github.com/rvagg/rust-fil-commp-generate/blob/edb2a8a837d344bf2ae0eff4384e0fb82c3b665e/src/lib.rs#L34-L56 to accommodate this new "PadReader" which does something completely different.

Happy to update this PR with a name change if that's acceptable.

/cc @vmx

title: feat: add support for running multiple low priority threads
body:
Instead of having only a flag to run a single or two threads, change
the `parallel` option to a number, to define how many threads should
be run. The first thread/process is always a high priority one, the
other ones are low priority.

`1` means running only a single high priority proof (this is what
`--parallel false` was), `2` means running a high and a low priority
proof (this is what `--parallel true` was), higher numbers mean
one high priority proof and n-1 low priority ones.

This is the code I conducted my tests with for https://github.com/filecoin-project/bellman/pull/66#issuecomment-593459604.

title: feat: add md hash and implement for Poseidon
body:
Add just enough support for Merkle-Damgard construction to use with Poseidon.

- Add `hash_md` and `hash_md_circuit` methods to `HashFunction` trait.
- Default `hash_md` implementation in terms of `hash2` (untested).
- No default implementation for `hash_md_circuit`.
- Implement both for `PoseidonDomain`.
- Use arity 36 by default.
- NOTE: Arity is a program-wide constant, 'PoseidonMDArity`.

title: feat: publish v22 params
feat(storage-proofs): reduce size of the graph cache
body:
After doing more benchmarks it showed that using `Vec<Vec<u32>>` has a
large memory overhead, when compared to a flattened `Vec<u32>`.

For sector size of `1 << 28` and `14` parents to cache, the resident
memory numbers are roughly

- `Vec<Vec<u32>>`:  21_289_684 kbytes
- `Vec<Box<[u32]>>`:  20_401_972 kbytes
- `Vec<u32>`: 14_681_016 kbytes

fix: uom 0.26 needs at least heim 0.0.9
body:
Without using heim version 0.0.9 explicitly, version 0.0.7 will be used implicitly,
which results in a broken build.

The error message prior to this fix is:

```
   Compiling fil-proofs-tooling v0.6.1 (/tmp/rust-fil-proofs/fil-proofs-tooling)
error[E0277]: the trait bound `uom::si::information::byte: uom::si::information::Unit` is not satisfied
   --> fil-proofs-tooling/src/metadata.rs:110:48
    |
110 |             memory_total_bytes: memory.total().get::<uom::si::information::byte>(),
    |                                                ^^^ the trait `uom::si::information::Unit` is not implemented for `uom::si::information::byte`

error[E0277]: the trait bound `uom::si::information::byte: uom::Conversion<u64>` is not satisfied
   --> fil-proofs-tooling/src/metadata.rs:110:48
    |
110 |             memory_total_bytes: memory.total().get::<uom::si::information::byte>(),
    |                                                ^^^ the trait `uom::Conversion<u64>` is not implemented for `uom::si::information::byte`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `fil-proofs-tooling`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

title: Merge pull request #1014 from filecoin-project/feat/phase2-jake
body:
### What's in this PR
- Adds param generation for PoSt
- Adds a CLI option for selecting circuit sector-size (PoRep and PoSt)
- Adds contribution verification
- Fixes build errors in the Dig's phase2 PR #1003 (this PR fixes all build errors except for invalid commit messages)

title: fix: error if duplicate challenges are passed to PoSt verification
body: A PoSt proof including the same sector challenge index more than once is invalid, since it claims more winners than it proves. Return an error if a call to `post_verify` attempts this.

title: feat(metrics): consolidate metrics scripts + improve cleanup
body:
## Why does this PR exist?

The previous mechanism of `rm -rf`'ing the temporary metrics directory is a little error prone in that the `rm` won't be run if the benchmarking script fails. Also, I'd duplicated a bunch of code needlessly across the Groth parameter-checker, micro, and benchy scripts.

Additionally, the old `with-lock.sh` script didn't handle leaked locks which could result from the process which acquired the lock having been `SIGKILL`'ed (or some other shutdown will circumvented the `TRAP`).

## What's in this PR?

- clean up any temporary directories created by metrics runs after 1 day
- consolidate all duplicated metrics scripts into single "run-remote.sh" script
- force-relinquish leaked locks

fix(benchmarking): clean temp directory on exit
body:
## Why does this PR exist?

The existing remote benchmarking code doesn't clean up the temp directory (in which it builds rust-fil-proofs), causing the host to run out of disk after a few days.

## What's in this PR?

This changeset removes the temporary directory after the benchmark completes.
